name: Limit Rules
latex: \lim(f + g) = \lim f + \lim g, \quad \lim(fg) = (\lim f)(\lim g), \quad \lim(f/g) = (\lim f)/(\lim g)
explanation: Limits follow algebraic rules that make them easier to compute. The limit of a sum is the sum of limits, the limit of a product is the product of limits, and the limit of a quotient is the quotient of limits (if denominator limit is nonzero). These properties allow us to break complex limits into simpler parts.
